title: Pasta W/ Arugula And Feta
summary: Pasta W/ Arugulan And Feta might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 2 servings with 949 calories, 35g of protein, and 49g of fat each. For $3.43 per serving, this recipe covers 26% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. If you have olive oil, parmesan, kosher salt & pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the lemon you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. It is a rather expensive recipe for fans of Mediterranean food. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 70%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes include Arugula & Feta Pasta, PASTA WITH PROSCIUTTO, ARUGULAn AND FETA, and Quinoa, Arugula, and Feta Salad.

winePairing.pairingText: Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio are great choices for Italian. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. The Mazzei Fonterutoli Chianti Classico with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 32 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mazzei Fonterutoli Chianti Classico
productMatches.description: "Lots of meat, berry and plum character on the nose and palate. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, rich finish. Decadent style that I like. Serious quality for the vintage. No Castello in 2002, so this was upgraded."-Wine SpectatorColor: Deep purplish-red but bright and exceptionally concentrated.Bouquet: Extremely intense and complex with scents of cherries and raspberries accompanied by light toasty and spicy shadings.Flavor: The impact in the mouth is incisive but soft due to a substantial structure of tannins in which those that are soft and well rounded stand out. Acidity is fused with the wine's body and aids the transmission of pleasant sensations of warmth and strength. The wine features a long finish that is unusual for a regular Chianti Classico.
